intro: Dockrillia cucumerina, commonly known as the cucumber dock, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as sorrel and buckwheat. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough, waxy texture and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a three-lobed, triangular capsule that contains several seeds. Dockrillia cucumerina is often found in moist soils along riverbanks and in woodland areas.
